attributes.action: increase bursaries for student midwives to a minimum of £6,500 per annum in line with the RCM's recommendations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
*The RCM proposes that all student midwives undertaking the three year pre-registration midwifery course whether at degree or diploma level are awarded a non-means tested bursary

*The level of the bursary should be at a minimum of £6500.00 per year

*Those students with dependants should still be able to benefit from the appropriate allowances

*Students on this non-means tested bursary should still have access to student loans and means tested benefits if they so wish

*A substantial bursary will aid recruitment and retention of midwifery students; the effectiveness of a substantial bursary has been demonstrated in recruiting trainee teachers.

(Above taken from the RCM's website)

*There should also be a London weighting to the bursary as with public sector jobs.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to increase bursaries for student midwives to a minimum of £6,500 per annum in line with the RCM's recommendations.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=midwifebursary
